data.title: First time in Alabama
data.text: and I had an awesome breakfast with great service. And when I asked for extra cheese, I got seriously extra cheese.  Wish I could go back to try their lunch menu.  The buffet they were setting up looked delicious.

data.title: you are in the grill
data.text: no ar conditioning - but the food is great - staff  almost none other than the cook. Buffet style pay before and eat all you want.

data.title: Good Southern Cookin
data.text: My family and I stopped here for dinner after visiting some attractions nearby. It was wonderful food. They hade delicious fried chicken. I tried as much food as my plate could hold. Everything I put in my mouth was delicious. We went on Sunday and there was a buffet. So we tried many many things. The pot roast was some of the best I've ever eaten. Squash was super yummy. I polished off my meal with some blackberry cobbler..now I've had some good cobbler in my day..but this right here was amazing. Even their sweet tea was good. Small town feel in a big city. Thanks

data.title: Southern country food
data.text: A simple small establishment, Magic City grill has a following downtown because of its inexpensive buffet with such staples as fried chicken, collard greens, corn muffins.  You can also order off a breakfast or lunch menu, but at a slower pace.

data.title: Good ole' home cookin
data.text: These people will put a hurting on you like you've never known.  The food taste like it came straight outta grandma's kitchen!!

data.title: Great Home Style Southern Cooking
data.text: We had Sunday buffet here all u can eat for $9. Great salad bar selection and excellent southern comfort food, chicken, grits, biscuits, meatloaf and  mac n cheese. Would recommend it

data.title: Pleasant Suprise
data.text: I was heading to the airport on my way back home and decided to pull off the e - way and try my luck on a place for lunch, and found the Magic City. I had the lunch buffet for under $ 9. It was some very good southern style cooking. They wait staff was very good as well.

data.title: Has potential
data.text: One lovely October morning, while still on medical leave after gallbladder surgery, I woke up craving chicken 'n waffles.  I Googled for a restaurant in town with C&W on the menu. Only 2 restaurants came up. The first I’ll try next time, but that day I decided to go here. After a nearly 30 minute drive I met a friend and we walked into MCG to a very cold non-greeting. No one acknowledged us and it was not obvious if/where we should sit. A waitress was passing by for a 2nd time so I stopped her and asked if we should seat ourselves. She dryly confirmed that we should. This waitress, older lady with pink hi-lites in her hair, pink jewelry and pink Chuck Taylor Converse sneakers (breast cancer awareness month? Rocked!!), ended up being our waitress. She was totally unfriendly during our entire visit.  She was dressed so spunky with an attitude that just didn’t fit. I thought it was just her personality or mood that day. But then the lunch crowd started trailing in and she was nice to everyone else who sat near us.  However, she stayed ice cold to us. So I’m taking the treatment personally. We gave her no reason to dislike us. Then our food came. I had fried chicken wings with waffles and scrambled eggs.  It was quite yummy.  The chicken was hard though, but tasty enough that I cleaned my plate. Unsure if I’ll ever go back. My score for MCG is low because the chicken was hard and the staff was so unfriendly to me and my friend. However, the food was quite tasty and maybe the chicken is not always hard.

data.title: Good food, but TERRIBLE customer service
data.text: Within the past 2 weeks I have had TERRIBLE RUDE experiences with this restaurant. The first time eating there in a long time was 2 weeks ago and the waitress was not friendly at all. She had an attitude and when asked to do something she either looked or responded like she didn't want to do it, by rolling eyes or just looking at me and my party like "are you serious?' Then I placed a call for a pick up order because I refused to sit in the restaurant. I placed my order and the person verified what I said and then just HUNG up without getting my name or even seeing if there was anything else I needed. Needless to say I didn't go pick up that order. The food is EXCELLENT, BUT if you want a good total experience GET YOUR FOOD AND LEAVE!!!!

data.title: Good ole Southern Food
data.text: Very nice breakfast omelet loaded with meat of your choice, toast, and coffee for $5.99. They serve a lunch buffet but I was there a bit too early to try it. I will next time I get down to B-Ham. Very old time charm one block South of the VA parking lot. I rated it Very Good, but it is really above average.
